alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 8:15PM CDT until May 09 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Twin Valley affecting Norman County. Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Roseau River at Roseau affecting Roseau County. .Additional rises are still expected on tributaries across northwest Minnesota at many locations as additional flow works into river systems. Decreases are forecast at Shelly, Warren, and Twin Valley where the rivers have likely crested. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, MAY 09... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Hawley. * WHEN...Until Monday, May 09. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Railroad underpass at US Hwy 10 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CDT Sunday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
